Introduction • This document describes the guidelines and requirements from Neom Public Safety Department regarding the system requirements and design requirements that should be followed for all projects that shall become part of Neom Public Safety Operations. 2. Standards • Below list of NEOM specifications, codes & Standards shall be applicable for all WORKS involved for Public Safety System design, delivery & execution: - Saudi Building Code (SBC) - International Building Code (IBC) - International Fire Code (IFC) - International Mechanical Code (IMC) - International Plumbing Code (IPC) - International Electrical Code (IEC) - International Energy Conservation Code (IECC) - American with Disability Act Accessibility Guidelines (ADAAG) - American Society for Testing Materials (ASTM) - American National Standard Institute (ANSI) - Council of American Building Officials (CABO) - National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) - Saudi Arabian Standards Organization Documents (SASO) - NEOM Sustainability Requirements - NEOM list of Codes & Standards - NEOM OSH Manual - NEOM Schedule E (Environmental Requirements of Tenderers) - American Society of Heating, Refrigeration & Air Conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE) - American Society of Plumbing Engineers (ASPE) - Uniform Plumbing Code (UPC) - American Water Works Association (AWWA) - Saudi National Water Company Specs (NWC) - Saudi Civil Defence Authority regulations (SCD) 3. Infrastructure Requirements • The Public Safety infrastructure shall have Facility Entry/Exit Gates, Data Centre Room, Telecom Rooms, Public Safety Operations (Control) Room, Radio Distribution Room dedicated for Public Safety Operations • The Data centre Room shall be the central location that connect to the backbone network from Neom Community Public Safety Network. • Telecom Room serves as the connection point for all the Public Safety devices in Facility. • A dedicated room for Radio Service Management shall be available named as Radio Distribution Room • Public Safety Operations Room shall be the heart of public safety operations monitoring. • Following section describes the Infrastructure Requirements for each area. Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements 3.1. Facility Entry/Exit Gates • All Entry/Exit Gates of the facility shall be under CCTV monitoring with dedicated cameras configured for Identification of everyone passing through the gates & dedicated cameras for overall surveillance of the Entry/Exit Gates. • Automatic Bollards, Road Blockers & Arm Barriers shall be installed at the Entry/Exit Gates to control Vehicle Access to the Facility • ANPR Cameras shall be installed at the Gates at sufficient height so it can cover number plates of all type of vehicles passing in and out through the Gates. • The Public Safety devices should be connected to the nearest Public Safety Network Cabinet in case the distance to Cabinet is within 80Meters. Otherwise, these devices should be connected to dedicated outdoor Public Safety Field Cabinet. • The connectivity between the Public Safety Devices at Entry/Exit Gates should be through Fiber optic cable and this Fiber optic cable should be routed through dedicated ducts and micro trenches of Public Safety • UPS shall be provided for power back up for the Public Safety assets situated in the Entry/Exit Gates including but not limited to Boom Barrier, Road Blockers, Turnstile Gates, workstations. • A workstation shall be provided at the Main Gate house to annunciate alarms that require Security interventions. 3.2. Data Center Room • A Data Centre Room shall be available in the facility to accommodate all the Public Safety Cabinets, namely System Cabinets, Network Cabinets, UPS • The Data Center Room spacing shall be enough to accommodate all Public Safety System Cabinets and the Central Network Cabinet that has the Public Safety Network Core Switches & its components. • The Data Center Room shall have Raised Floor with maintenance access and provision shall be available for installation of freestanding cabinets. • There shall be 2 separate Power feeder available to all public safety system cabinets with load capacity to power Public Safety Network Cabinets. • Cable Trays shall be installed to route all cables below raised floor. • This room should be under CCTV monitoring & should have Biometric Access Control System. • This room should be provided with proper Air Conditioning 24 x 7. • Data Center should have temperature monitoring from the network. 3.3. Telecom Room • A Telecom Room shall be available in each Buildings/Office Units. • The Telecom Room should accommodate Public Safety Network Cabinet 42U that will be connected to the Public Safety Network through Fiber. • There shall be 2 separate Power feeder available to all public safety system cabinets with load capacity to power Public Safety Network Cabinets. • The Telecom Room shall have Raised Floor with maintenance access and provision shall be available for installation of freestanding cabinets. • Cable Trays shall be installed to route all cables below raised floor. • The Telecom Room should be under CCTV monitoring & should have Biometric Access Control System. • The Telecom Room should be provided with proper Air Conditioning 24 x 7. Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements 3.4. Public Safety Operations Room • Dedicated Public Safety Security Operations Room shall be available with minimum 20 SQM sufficiently spaced to accommodate 4 operators & their Workstation console. • There shall be 4 Operator Workstations provided in Security Operations Room. • The operation room shall have Raised Floor with maintenance access. • Cable Trays shall be installed to route all cables below raised floor. • A Video wall should be provided with network video encoder and decoder in the Security Operations Room, and it should meet the minimum specification provided in section Error! Radio Distribution Room • Radio Distribution Room shall have space allocated enough to accommodate a supervisor desk, Radio Storage (lockable cabinets), Charger stations. • This Room should be under CCTV monitoring & should have Biometric Access Control System. • There shall be a Supervisor workstation in the Room. • Power allocation should be sufficient to charge the number of radios required for 2 shifts. 4. System Requirements • The Public Safety Systems shall include below listed systems and following sections describes each system requirements in detail: - Public Safety IT Infrastructure - Public Safety Network System (PSN) - Access control System (ACS) - Video Management System (VMS) - Public Safety Cyber Security System (SOC&NOC) - Computer Aided Dispatch System (CAD) - Physical Security Infrastructure Management System (PSIM) - Public Safety Service Management System (ITSM) 4.1. Public Safety IT Infrastructure • IT Infrastructure for Public Safety systems shall include below listed systems following sections describes each system requirements in detail: - System Cabinets - Network Cabinets - Physical Servers - Virtual Server Nodes - Storage - UPS - Operator Workstations - Videowall with network decoder & encoder - Radio Management Console/Workstation - KVM Unit Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements 4.1.1. System Cabinets • The System cabinet shall be designed to accommodate all public safety system servers in the Facility with sufficient free space for maintenance access. • The Cabinet shall be of 42U height provided with Glass Door/Finned Door, Dual Cooling Fans, Duel PDU, adequate number of Cable Management Units. • The Cabinet shall be Free Standing type with detachable caster wheels. • The Cabinet shall have cable entry from bottom. • It shall be possible to remove side covers of the cabinet for easy maintenance. • Slide rail mounting shall be provided for all the servers in the System Cabinet • Dedicated UPS shall be provided for power back up the Servers & equipment’s in the Cabinet and UPS should be monitor from network • The PDU shall have Fuse Protection, Earth Leak Safety, Individual Switch for each socket with power on status indication and there should be two PDUs and each PDU should be on separate power source. • Each equipment’s and the Cabinet shall be Tagged properly in the cabinet for easy identification. 4.1.2. Network Cabinets • The Network cabinet shall be designed to accommodate the Public Safety Network Core Switches & Distribution switches, Fiber/Copper Patch panels, Cable Managements, etc. • The Cabinet shall be of 42U height provided with Glass Door/Finned Door, Dual Cooling Fans, Duel PDU, adequate number of Cable Management Units. • The Cabinet shall be Free Standing type with detachable caster wheels. • It shall be possible to remove side covers of the cabinet for easy maintenance. • The Cabinet shall have cable entry from bottom. • Dedicated UPS shall be provided for power back up the Servers & equipment’s in the Cabinet and UPS should be monitor from network • The PDU shall have Fuse Protection, Earth Leak Safety, Individual Switch for each socket with power on status indication and there should be two PDUs and each PDU should be on separate power source. • Each equipment’s and the Cabinet shall be Tagged properly in the cabinet for easy identification. 4.1.3. Physical Servers • Servers provided for Public Safety System Solutions shall have dual Power Supply units shall be powered from different PDU’s in the System Cabinet • The servers shall be Rack mounting type and should be installed on sliding trays/rails for maintenance purpose. • There shall be minimum 2 network ports available in each server. • The server shall have minimum 1 TB storage and it shall be SSD type. • The servers should support RAID configurations and the Hard disks shall be accessible from front, easily removable. • It shall be possible to health monitor the servers through network. • The server units shall be provided with warranty of minimum 3 Years meeting the requirements given in section 4.1.4. Virtual Server Nodes • Virtual Server Node shall have dual Power Supply units and shall be powered from different PDU’s in the System Cabinet • The unit shall be Rack mounting type and should be installed on sliding trays/rails for maintenance purpose. Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements • There shall be minimum 4 network ports available in each unit. • The unit shall have minimum 1 TB storage and it shall be SSD type. • The unit shall have at least 50% free space/slot for future storage expansion • The servers should support RAID configurations and the Hard disks shall be accessible from front, easily removable. • It shall be possible to health monitor the servers through network. • Licenses & operations support for the unit should be provided with minimum 3 Years validity meeting the requirements given in section 4.1.5. Storage • Network Storage shall be compatible with the VMS system. • There shall be minimum 4 network ports available in each unit. 4.1.6. UPS • UPS shall be provided in the system cabinet to give power back up to the servers & equipment’s installed in the System Cabinets as well as the Network Cabinet. • The UPS shall be Rack mount type with option available for health monitoring through Network. • The UPS sizing shall be calculated for providing battery backup for a duration of 60Minutes. • The Batteries for the UPS shall be sealed Maintenance free installed within the UPS unit/modules and shall support Rack mounting. • The total load of UPS shall not be exceeding the 70% of UPS capacity. 4.1.7. Operator Workstations • The Operator workstation should include desktop PC with minimum 25” LCD monitor, Wireless Keyboard & mouse. • The Display & Workstation shall have a network port and minimum 1 HDMI port, 1D type port. • The workstation shall be able to operate multiple public safety application clients and shall not decay system performance. • The workstations shall have SSD hard drives with minimum 1TB storage. • A powerful graphic card shall be provided with the workstation that should enable smooth CCTV feed monitoring for 24x7 streaming of minimum 10 Cameras. • Docking station shall be provided that can accept Keyboard Video inputs and multiple HDMI displays Videowall. • The Videowall solution shall be provided with minimum specification given below: Videowall Configuration Requirement Specification Requirement Specification Requirement Screen Size 55” Number of Screen 6Nos Screen Matrix 4 x Videowall Controller Controller capable to accept inputs from all operator workstations and output to connect all videowall screens. Radio Management Console/Workstation • A Radio Management Conole shall be provided for managing the Radio Operations including Channel Assignment, Device Status monitoring, etc. • Based on the management system requirement, either manufacturer standard Radion Management Console Unit or a workstation with radio management software tools shall be provided. • In case of requirement of a dedicated workstation for the Radio Management, the workstation unit shall meet the requirements explained in section 4.1. 4.1.9. KVM Unit • It is recommended to provide a KVM unit in the System Cabinet that can be used for accessing all the servers installed in the system cabinets. • The use of KVM is optional but recommended as this can helps the maintenance operations. • The KVM shall be rack mount type with foldable display and shall accept minimum 6 inputs. 4.2. Public Safety Network System (PSN) • A dedicated network shall be available for Public Safety System communication infrastructure from other networks. • The Network design shall provide end-to-end connectivity of systems. • All equipment/software required to provide a complete end-to-end security solution shall be provided. • The solution must be based on the open system architecture and standards, so devices of other vendors can be used in the future. • Public Safety Network Infrastructure shall consist of below components, meeting the specification requirement in in the following section: - NGFW SD-WAN Firewalls - Core Switches - Distribution Switches - Access indoor L3 switches, - Access outdoor L3 switches, - SFP’s - Fiber Patch Panels - Copper Patch panels - Field Equipment Cabinets - Fiber & Copper Cable Network. 4.2.1. NGFW SD-WAN Firewalls • The proposed system should support unlimited users / IP addresses license. Core Switches • High-density access: Up to 48 multi-GE ports per board and 384 multi-GE ports per chassis — which are 10GE capable. • facilitate unified access for high densities of terminals. • Ultra-high reliability: Redundancy design for key components ensures carrier-grade reliability. The dual-active detection (DAD) mechanism for the two main control boards automatically switches over services upon detecting a fault in any main control board, ensuring service continuity. • Superpower over Ethernet (PoE): Innovative optical-electrical synergy technology supports PoE power supply at ultra-long distances. Up to 90 W PoE++ on a single port supplies power to APs, IP phones, and other high-power terminals. • Energy saving: Innovative "Y + Psi (ψ)"-type front-to-rear air duct design for heat dissipation and mixed-flow fan technology delivers low power consumption, low noise, strong heat dissipation, and energy saving. • Deployment automation: CloudEngine supports VXLAN and BGP EVPN, and builds a Unified Virtual Fabric (UVF) • to automate deployment of up to 512 Virtual Networks (VNs). In this way, multiple service networks or tenant networks can be deployed and isolated from each other on the same physical network, truly achieving one network for multiple purposes. • Policy automation: CloudEngine uses SDN to automate deployment of wired and wireless user policies and • implement refined management and control, achieving free mobility. • The Switches supports many Layer 2/Layer 3 multicast protocols such as PIM SM, PIM DM, PIM SSM, MLD, and IGMP snooping, to support multi-terminal high- definition video surveillance and video conferencing services. • The Switches supports multiple Layer 3 features including OSPF, and VRRP, meeting enterprises' requirements on access and aggregation service bearing, and enabling a variety of voice, video, and data applications. • The Switches supports MAC address authentication, 802. 1x authentication, and Portal authentication, and implements dynamic delivery of policies (VLAN, QoS, and ACL) to users. • The Switches provides a series of mechanisms to defend against DoS and user- targeted attacks. • The Switches sets up and maintains a DHCP snooping binding table and discards the packets that do not match the table entries. • The Switches supports strict ARP learning, which protects a network against ARP spoofing attacks to ensure normal network access. • The capabilities facilitate device deployment, upgrade, service provisioning, and other management and maintenance operations, and also greatly reduce O&M costs. Outdoor Access Switches • The power supply and network board integrated module must fan less design, support natural heat dissipation. • Support -40°C to +75°C operation temperature • The power system output power should be less than 120 W. • Supply multiple output voltage, such as 12Vdc, 24Vac, PoE / PoE+ and etc. • Support 802.3af PoE, 802.3at PoE+ and 802.3bt PoE++. • Support at least 8 x 10/100/1000Base-T Ethernet ports, 2 x 1GE SFP ports. • Support SSH, Web managed configuration and SNMP. • Support ring protection protocol ERPS. • Support 250 meter long-distance PoE transmission. • Support PoE watchdog that can auto-detect-and-reboot faulty cameras. 4.2.6. Installation Requirements • All outdoor public safety system cables shall run inside ducts which are laydown in micro trenches with handholes distributed to provide easy access for maintenance and expansions. • The micro trenches shall have a minimum of 2 spare ducts. • Electrical cable shall not share same ducts used by CAT6e UTP cables • All wires and electrical connections shall be concealed in places that are not visible, so they are difficult to temper with, cut, or extend in metal pipes in areas easily accessible for visible. 4.3. Access control System (ACS) • The ACS system solution shall be compatible with existing Public Safety ACS System in Public Safety Command and Control Center at Neom Community 1. • The ACS system requirements are divided in to following segments: - Access Control Requirements - ACS system Software Requirements - Facial Recognition Requirements - Integration Requirements - Installation Requirements - ACS System Component Specifications • Following section briefs the each of these requirements in details. Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements 4.3.1. Access Control Design Requirements • The access control software shall be matching the existing system available in Command and Control Center at Neom Community 1with full capabilities to work in standalone or as an extended system to provide unified data and management of the system. • The Access Control System (ACS) shall control and monitor all doors and gates in the Facility. • Biometric units with QR code readers shall be provided at main doors of facilities and selected offices • The access control system should be equipped with QR code and face recognition features. • The Access Control System components shall be as per the system requirement provided in section 4.3. • The System design shall be capable of withstanding single point failure and shall have redundant servers. • All Pedestrian Entry/Exit Gates house shall be secured with Swing Barrier turnstile Gate for pedestrian entrance with face recognition units for both ways (in / Out) • The Swing Barrier turnstile gate of outdoor rated shall be provided for outdoor Pedestrian Entry/Exit points with face recognition units for both ways (in / Out) • For all the Vehicle Entry/Exit points traffic lane shall be secured with Cylinder bollards 4units distributed evenly to provide the maximum protection against hostiles. • Electrical automatic raise arm barriers shall be provided in each traffic lane at all the Vehicle Control Center at Neom Community 1 and control Center in the Facility • It should be possible to perform all ACS system operations including User Access Management, Report generations, System Administration from the Common Command Control Center in Neom Community • The ACS system design and material submittal shall be submitted for approval before proceeding with procurement and installation. • Detailed System Architecture & Layout drawings of the access control system shall be provided. 4.3.2. ACS System Software Requirements • The access control system (ACS) solution including the Field devices, servers & software’s should be compatible to the existing Central Access Control System situated in Neom Community • Access Control Software client capable to manage all Access Control Operations • The system architecture shall support multiple-site system connections like virtual private network-VPN, local area network (LAN), or wide area network (WAN). • Access Control system should provide a mechanism to enable security staff to give access to personnel based on different roles and can limit the access to specific areas for visitors and staff members. • System should have the capability to add/delete/modify access levels only by authorized staff. • The system shall support below functionality: - manually adding or automatically discovering people's access gates. - maintain the equipment information of the devices (add time, online, model, etc.). - search device list by device information. - manually modify or delete the device. - view the traffic record of the device. - intrusion detection through access control devices - Activation or Deactivation of devices remotely and locally. - capability to restrict access for required defined roles by on click function in special scenarios. - manually add or import personnel information in a batch file. This capability provides a checklist to help the operator quickly assess alarms. • The PSIM shall support service management functionalities such as service request creation. • The users should be able to raise incidents, update incidents and follow dedicated Standard Operation Procedures • The solution shall be having individual Standard Operation Procedures developed for all categories of incidents. • The SOP shall have features to allow user to monitor cameras & control door access where the SOP action demands. • It shall be possible to update incident status, user assignments, review SLA, get notified on email/SMS. 4.7.2. 3D Navigation Management • The Map layout used by PSIM shall be 3dimensional supported with high quality graphics. • It shall be possible to update the map by the system administrator whenever new version with latest changes are received. • The map shall support zoom on ground level that could give the user a more realistic view. • The application Map shall have key concepts described below. - Targets - Targets represent a person, vehicle, or other detected entity at a particular location on the map. - Zones - Zones are geographic areas that are monitored for activity. This provides the ability for a geographic area to behave like a virtual sensor. • It shall be possible to have automated navigation within the map between locations. 4.7.3. Administration Management • The PSIM shall have separate user administration interface that will have options for the users to be categorized into different groups & privileges. • The Administration features should also include contact import/update, user access control to PSIM etc. • The PSIM administration features need to have provision to update location tree, asset coordinates, etc in the application. 4.7.4. System User Interface Requirements • PSIM systems shall have below modules available for operations. - Maps that provide the geographical map display which allows the user to interact with sensors, cameras, targets, and other map objects through their associated icons. These maps can be either 2D or 3D. - Map View Controls: Provides controls to pan/zoom the map and basic map navigation capabilities. - 3D Design for the buildings and infrastructure. - Alarm Queue: Provides the ability to manage alarms received from sensors, zones, and other devices. - Main Dashboard: Provides quick access capabilities to operator tools including Devices/Tracks, Mapping, Applications - Notification Bar - System shall Provide notification and status information about the systems being monitored. - Coordinate Readout - Displays the geographic coordinates of the cursor. - Details Pane: Displays detailed information for the currently selected map object, such as sensors, tracks, or zone information. - Hot Keys: Provides short-cuts to the system’s functionality using the keyboard or mouse. Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements - Search capability for other functions such as below: Map Context Menu, Right clicking on the map presents the Map Context Menu providing functions for the specified map coordinate, Device Context - Menu - System shall display the device information, Autopoint features shall be used to automatically point a camera to a location on the map. It is also used to assign cameras to track targets on the map. • Help: Using the Help facility is the best way to learn about system functionality. The Help facility describes all of the system display elements as well as operational concepts. The Help provides a simple browser-based interface and is searchable to enable easy retrieval of information on any topic of interest. • Common tasks that the operator should do: Monitor and acknowledge alarms, Assets, and secure alarms. • Enterprise Manger Configuration /Admin panel - Administrators should have their own panel for system configurations, Systems configurations shall be not limited to the network connections, Defining Sites, GIS Server configuration, NTP server configuration. • Digital Video Panel: The Digital Video Panel (DVP) provides an important companion application to the system display. The DVP provides the operator with a managed display of video feeds, as well as camera control, across all sites that the user may be monitoring. In addition, the DVP has the capability to display the video for each alarm in the alarm queue in order, allowing the user to assess multiple alarms simultaneously or easily focus on the video of highest interest. • Licensing - Provide a valid licensing for any needed Hardware and Applications, • Dashboard - PSIM should show a dashboard display for the system behaviour, operator behaviour, incidents, Network, etc. • Mobile app for tracking and monitoring • Dispatching features 4.7.5. System Integration Requirements • The system shall be integrated with the following Systems. - Integrated with IP Telephony system – To enable functionalities such as receive & initiate calls to/from users/security personals, field operators, etc. - Integrated with VMS System– To enable functionalities such as access to live/recorded video streams, receive/acknowledge VMS system alarms including video analytic alarms. - Integrated with ACS System– To enable functionalities such as Open/Close operation of all doors secured via Access Control System, receive/acknowledge ACS system alarms. - Integrated with MyHR System– To enable functionalities namely granting access to PSIM application based on their Active Directory credentials and allow PSIM operators to monitor user profile if required as part of SOP’s. 4.8. Public Safety Service Management (ITSM) • The Service Management provided by the vendor should include the following modules: - Incident Management - Problem Management - Change Management - Service Asset and Configuration Management - Release Management - Request Fulfilment • Managed Services shall have below services: Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements Service Description Desk and Field Support Providing IT end user services, service desk and providing field support. Providing security network services including connectivity, LAN, WAN, and Network Services other network related activity. Managed Security Services consists of three main service components: Managed Security Security Monitoring and Device Management, Incident Response, and Risk Services and Compliance. • The objectives of the manged services are but not limited to: - Increased availability (less downtime) - Ensure compliance with cyber security requirements. - Increased security and compliance (risk mitigation, improved security documentation and processes) - Provide remote and deskside support to security operators and all NEOM users of online security services that includes Visitor Requests, ID requests, Access Permits requests, Journey requests, etc. the support involves Incidents, problems, Service requests, request of information etc. - Manage all current vendors and ongoing warranty contracts. - Dispatch and monitor Break/Fix repairs, including Services performed by other Service Providers. - Perform approved Install, Moves, Adds, Changes, Deletes IMACD Services for Hardware and Software for Security operators only. - Track the inventory of security systems Software and Hardware as required that include CCTV, FR devices, Radars, workstations, servers, switches, routers, firewall, applications, systems and any other system, software, or hardware under security systems etc. - Track warranty and licenses for security systems Software and Hardware following the asset management process and the End-User Device depot Service. - Deploy and manage security systems Software. - Maintain current applications and Software including upgrades, patches, performance monitoring, recommendations for enhancement, security requirements, etc. - Build a workstation image and maintain it. 5. Licenses • All required software and hardware licenses for fully operational system should be providing. • Licenses for all components of the system shall be provided valid 3 Years from the handover to NEOM. • Licenses should cover a number of users operating the system for 3 years. • If licenses are for a number of users working with the system simultaneously then the number of such users should be extended by at least 1 user to cover Public Safety Command and Control Center connection. Introduction • This document describes the guidelines and requirements from Neom Public Safety Department regarding the system requirements and design requirements that should be followed for all projects that shall become part of Neom Public Safety Operations. 2. Standards • Below list of NEOM specifications, codes & Standards shall be applicable for all WORKS involved for Public Safety System design, delivery & execution: - Saudi Building Code (SBC) - International Building Code (IBC) - International Fire Code (IFC) - International Mechanical Code (IMC) - International Plumbing Code (IPC) - International Electrical Code (IEC) - International Energy Conservation Code (IECC) - American with Disability Act Accessibility Guidelines (ADAAG) - American Society for Testing Materials (ASTM) - American National Standard Institute (ANSI) - Council of American Building Officials (CABO) - National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) - Saudi Arabian Standards Organization Documents (SASO) - NEOM Sustainability Requirements - NEOM list of Codes & Standards - NEOM OSH Manual - NEOM Schedule E (Environmental Requirements of Tenderers) - American Society of Heating, Refrigeration & Air Conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE) - American Society of Plumbing Engineers (ASPE) - Uniform Plumbing Code (UPC) - American Water Works Association (AWWA) - Saudi National Water Company Specs (NWC) - Saudi Civil Defence Authority regulations (SCD) 3. Infrastructure Requirements • The Public Safety infrastructure shall have Facility Entry/Exit Gates, Data Centre Room, Telecom Rooms, Public Safety Operations (Control) Room, Radio Distribution Room dedicated for Public Safety Operations • The Data centre Room shall be the central location that connect to the backbone network from Neom Community Public Safety Network. • Telecom Room serves as the connection point for all the Public Safety devices in Facility. • A dedicated room for Radio Service Management shall be available named as Radio Distribution Room • Public Safety Operations Room shall be the heart of public safety operations monitoring. • Following section describes the Infrastructure Requirements for each area. Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements 3.1. Facility Entry/Exit Gates • All Entry/Exit Gates of the facility shall be under CCTV monitoring with dedicated cameras configured for Identification of everyone passing through the gates & dedicated cameras for overall surveillance of the Entry/Exit Gates. • Automatic Bollards, Road Blockers & Arm Barriers shall be installed at the Entry/Exit Gates to control Vehicle Access to the Facility • ANPR Cameras shall be installed at the Gates at sufficient height so it can cover number plates of all type of vehicles passing in and out through the Gates. • The Public Safety devices should be connected to the nearest Public Safety Network Cabinet in case the distance to Cabinet is within 80Meters. Otherwise, these devices should be connected to dedicated outdoor Public Safety Field Cabinet. • The connectivity between the Public Safety Devices at Entry/Exit Gates should be through Fiber optic cable and this Fiber optic cable should be routed through dedicated ducts and micro trenches of Public Safety • UPS shall be provided for power back up for the Public Safety assets situated in the Entry/Exit Gates including but not limited to Boom Barrier, Road Blockers, Turnstile Gates, workstations. • A workstation shall be provided at the Main Gate house to annunciate alarms that require Security interventions. 3.2. Data Center Room • A Data Centre Room shall be available in the facility to accommodate all the Public Safety Cabinets, namely System Cabinets, Network Cabinets, UPS • The Data Center Room spacing shall be enough to accommodate all Public Safety System Cabinets and the Central Network Cabinet that has the Public Safety Network Core Switches & its components. • The Data Center Room shall have Raised Floor with maintenance access and provision shall be available for installation of freestanding cabinets. • There shall be 2 separate Power feeder available to all public safety system cabinets with load capacity to power Public Safety Network Cabinets. • Cable Trays shall be installed to route all cables below raised floor. • This room should be under CCTV monitoring & should have Biometric Access Control System. • This room should be provided with proper Air Conditioning 24 x 7. • Data Center should have temperature monitoring from the network. 3.3. Telecom Room • A Telecom Room shall be available in each Buildings/Office Units. • The Telecom Room should accommodate Public Safety Network Cabinet 42U that will be connected to the Public Safety Network through Fiber. • There shall be 2 separate Power feeder available to all public safety system cabinets with load capacity to power Public Safety Network Cabinets. • The Telecom Room shall have Raised Floor with maintenance access and provision shall be available for installation of freestanding cabinets. • Cable Trays shall be installed to route all cables below raised floor. • The Telecom Room should be under CCTV monitoring & should have Biometric Access Control System. • The Telecom Room should be provided with proper Air Conditioning 24 x 7. Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements 3.4. Public Safety Operations Room • Dedicated Public Safety Security Operations Room shall be available with minimum 20 SQM sufficiently spaced to accommodate 4 operators & their Workstation console. • There shall be 4 Operator Workstations provided in Security Operations Room. • The operation room shall have Raised Floor with maintenance access. • Cable Trays shall be installed to route all cables below raised floor. • A Video wall should be provided with network video encoder and decoder in the Security Operations Room, and it should meet the minimum specification provided in section Error! Reference source not found. • Videowall should be installed at adequate height to ensure full visibility from all the operator desks. • The Security Operator Room should be under CCTV monitoring & should have Biometric Access Control System. • The Security Operator Room should be provided with proper Air Conditioning 24 x 7. 3.5. Radio Distribution Room • Radio Distribution Room shall have space allocated enough to accommodate a supervisor desk, Radio Storage (lockable cabinets), Charger stations. • This Room should be under CCTV monitoring & should have Biometric Access Control System. • There shall be a Supervisor workstation in the Room. • Power allocation should be sufficient to charge the number of radios required for 2 shifts. 4. System Requirements • The Public Safety Systems shall include below listed systems and following sections describes each system requirements in detail: - Public Safety IT Infrastructure - Public Safety Network System (PSN) - Access control System (ACS) - Video Management System (VMS) - Public Safety Cyber Security System (SOC&NOC) - Computer Aided Dispatch System (CAD) - Physical Security Infrastructure Management System (PSIM) - Public Safety Service Management System (ITSM) 4.1. Public Safety IT Infrastructure • IT Infrastructure for Public Safety systems shall include below listed systems following sections describes each system requirements in detail: - System Cabinets - Network Cabinets - Physical Servers - Virtual Server Nodes - Storage - UPS - Operator Workstations - Videowall with network decoder & encoder - Radio Management Console/Workstation - KVM Unit Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements 4.1.1. System Cabinets • The System cabinet shall be designed to accommodate all public safety system servers in the Facility with sufficient free space for maintenance access. • The Cabinet shall be of 42U height provided with Glass Door/Finned Door, Dual Cooling Fans, Duel PDU, adequate number of Cable Management Units. • The Cabinet shall be Free Standing type with detachable caster wheels. • The Cabinet shall have cable entry from bottom. • It shall be possible to remove side covers of the cabinet for easy maintenance. • Slide rail mounting shall be provided for all the servers in the System Cabinet • Dedicated UPS shall be provided for power back up the Servers & equipment’s in the Cabinet and UPS should be monitor from network • The PDU shall have Fuse Protection, Earth Leak Safety, Individual Switch for each socket with power on status indication and there should be two PDUs and each PDU should be on separate power source. • Each equipment’s and the Cabinet shall be Tagged properly in the cabinet for easy identification. 4.1.2. Network Cabinets • The Network cabinet shall be designed to accommodate the Public Safety Network Core Switches & Distribution switches, Fiber/Copper Patch panels, Cable Managements, etc. • The Cabinet shall be of 42U height provided with Glass Door/Finned Door, Dual Cooling Fans, Duel PDU, adequate number of Cable Management Units. • The Cabinet shall be Free Standing type with detachable caster wheels. • It shall be possible to remove side covers of the cabinet for easy maintenance. • The Cabinet shall have cable entry from bottom. • Dedicated UPS shall be provided for power back up the Servers & equipment’s in the Cabinet and UPS should be monitor from network • The PDU shall have Fuse Protection, Earth Leak Safety, Individual Switch for each socket with power on status indication and there should be two PDUs and each PDU should be on separate power source. • Each equipment’s and the Cabinet shall be Tagged properly in the cabinet for easy identification. 4.1.3. Physical Servers • Servers provided for Public Safety System Solutions shall have dual Power Supply units shall be powered from different PDU’s in the System Cabinet • The servers shall be Rack mounting type and should be installed on sliding trays/rails for maintenance purpose. • There shall be minimum 2 network ports available in each server. • The server shall have minimum 1 TB storage and it shall be SSD type. • The servers should support RAID configurations and the Hard disks shall be accessible from front, easily removable. • It shall be possible to health monitor the servers through network. • The server units shall be provided with warranty of minimum 3 Years meeting the requirements given in section 4.1.4. Virtual Server Nodes • Virtual Server Node shall have dual Power Supply units and shall be powered from different PDU’s in the System Cabinet • The unit shall be Rack mounting type and should be installed on sliding trays/rails for maintenance purpose. Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements • There shall be minimum 4 network ports available in each unit. • The unit shall have minimum 1 TB storage and it shall be SSD type. • The unit shall have at least 50% free space/slot for future storage expansion • The servers should support RAID configurations and the Hard disks shall be accessible from front, easily removable. • It shall be possible to health monitor the servers through network. • Licenses & operations support for the unit should be provided with minimum 3 Years validity meeting the requirements given in section 4.1.5. Storage • Network Storage shall be compatible with the VMS system. • There shall be minimum 4 network ports available in each unit. 4.1.6. UPS • UPS shall be provided in the system cabinet to give power back up to the servers & equipment’s installed in the System Cabinets as well as the Network Cabinet. • The UPS shall be Rack mount type with option available for health monitoring through Network. • The UPS sizing shall be calculated for providing battery backup for a duration of 60Minutes. • The Batteries for the UPS shall be sealed Maintenance free installed within the UPS unit/modules and shall support Rack mounting. • The total load of UPS shall not be exceeding the 70% of UPS capacity. 4.1.7. Operator Workstations • The Operator workstation should include desktop PC with minimum 25” LCD monitor, Wireless Keyboard & mouse. • The Display & Workstation shall have a network port and minimum 1 HDMI port, 1D type port. • The workstation shall be able to operate multiple public safety application clients and shall not decay system performance. • The workstations shall have SSD hard drives with minimum 1TB storage. • A powerful graphic card shall be provided with the workstation that should enable smooth CCTV feed monitoring for 24x7 streaming of minimum 10 Cameras. • Docking station shall be provided that can accept Keyboard Video inputs and multiple HDMI displays Videowall. • The Videowall solution shall be provided with minimum specification given below: Videowall Configuration Requirement Specification Requirement Specification Requirement Screen Size 55” Number of Screen 6Nos Screen Matrix 4 x Videowall Controller Controller capable to accept inputs from all operator workstations and output to connect all videowall screens. Radio Management Console/Workstation • A Radio Management Conole shall be provided for managing the Radio Operations including Channel Assignment, Device Status monitoring, etc. • Based on the management system requirement, either manufacturer standard Radion Management Console Unit or a workstation with radio management software tools shall be provided. • In case of requirement of a dedicated workstation for the Radio Management, the workstation unit shall meet the requirements explained in section 4.1. 4.1.9. KVM Unit • It is recommended to provide a KVM unit in the System Cabinet that can be used for accessing all the servers installed in the system cabinets. • The use of KVM is optional but recommended as this can helps the maintenance operations. • The KVM shall be rack mount type with foldable display and shall accept minimum 6 inputs. 4.2. Public Safety Network System (PSN) • A dedicated network shall be available for Public Safety System communication infrastructure from other networks. • The Network design shall provide end-to-end connectivity of systems. • All equipment/software required to provide a complete end-to-end security solution shall be provided. • The solution must be based on the open system architecture and standards, so devices of other vendors can be used in the future. • Public Safety Network Infrastructure shall consist of below components, meeting the specification requirement in in the following section: - NGFW SD-WAN Firewalls - Core Switches - Distribution Switches - Access indoor L3 switches, - Access outdoor L3 switches, - SFP’s - Fiber Patch Panels - Copper Patch panels - Field Equipment Cabinets - Fiber & Copper Cable Network. 4.2.1. NGFW SD-WAN Firewalls • The proposed system should support unlimited users / IP addresses license. Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements • The solution shall be based on a dedicated custom ASIC-based standalone appliance which should include: - Content Processor that accelerates content scanning activities such as AV and IPS. - Network Processors used for acceleration of many key security functions including stateful packet header inspection, VPN encryption/decryption, protocol anomaly offloading, and quality of service enforcement. It should also provide acceleration for processing all packet sizes which include time-sensitive applications such as VoIP, real-time protocols, and multimedia applications. • The device should be from a family of products that attains ICSA Labs Certifications for Antivirus, Corporate Firewall, IPsec, NIPS, SSL-TLS. • The unit shall have Phase-2 IPv6 Ready Logo Certification and successfully fulfilled all requirements for IPv6 Phase- 2 Core Support as a router product. • The Firewall solution shall be a Leader in the latest Gartner Magic Quadrant for UTM and Firewalls • The solution shall have "Recommended" rating from NSS Labs for NGFW testing, DCIPS testing, Firewall testing, NGIPS testing. • The solution shall have Common Criteria FWcPP (V2.0) + IPS (V2.11) and VPN (V2.1) Certification Recommended Firewall specifications Specification Requirement 1/10 GE SFP28 Slots 1 GE RJ45 Ports 1 GE SFP slots Onboard Storage 480 GB SSD USB Ports Power Redundant Firewall Latency (64 byte, UDP) 4.8 µs IPv4 Firewall Throughput 27 Gbps Application Control Throughput (HTTP 64K) 13 Gbps IPS Throughput 5 Gbps NGFW Throughput 3.5 Gbps Threat Protection Throughput 3 Gbps Firewall Throughput (Packets Per Second) 27 Gbps Concurrent Sessions 3 million New Sessions per second 280, Firewall Policies 10, IPsec VPN Throughput 13 Gbps Version 2.2 External of External Public Safety System Requirements Recommended Firewall specifications Specification Requirement Gateway-to-Gateway IPsec VPN Tunnels 2, Client-to-Gateway IPsec VPN Tunnels 16, SSL-VPN Throughput 2Gbps SSL Inspection CPS (IPS, avg.
